title: Update regarding Stratos Defense
story_body:
STRATOS DEFENSE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED ANNOUNCES PERSONNEL APPOINTMENTS AND CORPORATE UPDATES

ARLINGTON, VIRGINIA—March 14, 2024, 09:15 EST—Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated (NYSE: STR) issued a routine corporate update addressing personnel changes, marketing activities, and environmental compliance matters.

The company announced the appointment of Jennifer Caldwell as Vice President of Supply Chain Operations, effective April 1, 2024. Caldwell previously served as Senior Director of Logistics at Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated since 2019. She replaces Michael Torres, who is transitioning to a senior advisory role within the organization. Caldwell holds a Master of Business Administration from Georgetown University and has eighteen years of experience in defense sector supply chain management.

In marketing developments, Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated confirmed its participation in the upcoming Defense and Security Equipment International exhibition scheduled for September 2024 in London, United Kingdom. The company will occupy booth space in Hall 5 of the ExCeL London convention center. This represents the company's seventh consecutive year attending the biennial trade show.

Additionally, Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated announced completion of its annual environmental compliance audit for fiscal year 2023. The audit, conducted by third-party environmental consulting firm Environmental Compliance Associates LLC, covered all seventeen domestic manufacturing facilities operated by Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated. The audit identified zero major non-conformances and three minor administrative documentation gaps related to stormwater management reporting at the Huntsville, Alabama facility. Corrective actions have been implemented.

The company also reported the publication of its annual sustainability report, which documents energy consumption, waste generation, and water usage across operations. The report indicates a 2.3 percent reduction in electricity consumption per square foot of manufacturing space compared to fiscal year 2022, attributed to LED lighting upgrades at six facilities.

Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated employs approximately 8,400 personnel across operations in twelve states. The company manufactures electronic warfare systems, radar components, and communications equipment for military and government customers.

No financial guidance was provided in conjunction with these announcements. The company's next scheduled earnings release is May 8, 2024, covering first quarter fiscal year 2024 results.

Further information is available through the Stratos Defense Systems Incorporated investor relations department.
